summary: This is an email from a U.S. Pretrial Services Officer Specialist to counsel, transmitting a confidential bail report for Ghislaine Maxwell ahead of her remote court hearing scheduled for the following day. The email emphasizes the confidential nature of the report.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the confidential bail report attached to the email, scheduled to appear remotely before the court the following day.

persons.name: U.S. Pretrial Services Officer Specialist - Intake Coordinator
persons.context: The sender of the email who completed the pretrial interview/report for Ghislaine Maxwell and will dial into the hearing.

connections.person1: U.S. Pretrial Services Officer Specialist - Intake Coordinator
connections.description: The officer completed the pretrial interview and report for the defendant, Maxwell, and is involved in her bail proceedings.

events.title: Remote Bail Hearing for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to appear remotely before the court for a hearing, presumably related to her bail conditions.

keyFacts: A confidential bail report was prepared for Ghislaine Maxwell by U.S. Pretrial Services.
Maxwell was scheduled for a remote court hearing on July 14, 2020, the day after this email was sent.
The bail report is explicitly not public record and is to remain confidential under Title 18 U.S.C. ยง 3153(c)(1).
The document highlights the procedural steps in Maxwell's pretrial detention and bail process in the Southern District of New York.
Defense counsel and the Government are the only parties authorized to receive the confidential pretrial report.
